com.wikitude.camera

Interface CameraManager


  • public interface CameraManager
    Interface to control the camera. Camera settings are only available after CameraManagerListener.onCameraOpen() and before CameraManagerListener.onCameraReleased() were invoked.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Interface and Description
      static interface  CameraManager.FovChangedListener

        void setCameraPosition(CameraSettings.CameraPosition cameraPosition_)
        Call to change which camera should be used (front, back)
        Parameters:
        cameraPosition_ - Camera which should be used (front, back)
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the camera position is null.

      • getCameraPosition

        CameraSettings.CameraPosition getCameraPosition()
        Call to get the current camera position
        Returns:
        Current camera position

      • setFocusMode

        void setFocusMode(CameraSettings.CameraFocusMode focusMode_)
        Call to change the focus mode of the camera (once, continuous)
        Parameters:
        focusMode_ - Focus mode which should be used (once, continuous)
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the camera focus mode is null.

      • getFocusMode

        CameraSettings.CameraFocusMode getFocusMode()
        Call to get the currently set focus mode
        Returns:
        Currently set focus mode

      • isManualFocusAvailable

        boolean isManualFocusAvailable()
        Checks if the currently active camera is supporting setting the focus distance manually.
        Returns:
        true if manual focus is available

      • setManualFocusDistance

        void setManualFocusDistance(float focusDistance)
        Set the camera focus distance.
        0 = Shortest distance from frontmost surface of the lens that can be brought into sharp focus.
        1 = Infinity Focus.
        If setting the focus distance is not supported by the camera this value will be internally set to 0.
        Parameters:
        focusDistance - focus distance.

      • getManualFocusDistance

        float getManualFocusDistance()
        Get the camera focus distance in %.
        0 = Shortest distance from frontmost surface of the lens that can be brought into sharp focus.
        1 = Infinity Focus.
        Returns:
        focus distance.

      • setZoomLevel

        void setZoomLevel(float zoomLevel_)
        Call to set the zoom in or zoom out, call getMaxZoomLevel first to get the maximum possible value
        Parameters:
        zoomLevel_ - Zoom level to be set

      • getCurrentZoomLevel

        float getCurrentZoomLevel()
        Call to get the currently set zoom level
        Returns:
        Currently set zoom level

      • getMaxZoomLevel

        float getMaxZoomLevel()
        Call to check the maximum zoom level, should be called before setting the zoom level
        Returns:
        Maximum zoom level of the current device

      • setListener

        void setListener(CameraManagerListener listener_)
        Call to set a listener object. The listener can then be used to react on certain camera related events.
        Parameters:
        listener_ - The CameraManager listener. Providing null will unset the previous listener.

      • getListener

        CameraManagerListener getListener()
        Returns the currently registered listener object.
        Returns:
        The currently registered listener or null

      • isFocusPointOfInterestSupported

        boolean isFocusPointOfInterestSupported()
        Returns:
        true if the devices supports this feature.

      • setFocusPointOfInterest

        void setFocusPointOfInterest(float pointX,
                             float pointY)
        Sets the point where the camera tries to focus on. The camera will immediately try to focus on the set position.
        This setting is only available in combination with CameraSettings.CameraFocusMode#ONCE and will not work in other focus modes.

        To check if a device supports this feature isFocusPointOfInterestSupported() can be used.

        To utilize this feature a 2D input position on the render surface is required. This can be done by using the OnTouchListener of the render view.
        Parameters:
        pointX - the pixel coordinate in the x axis of the render surface.
        pointY - the pixel coordinate in the y axis of the render surface.
        See Also:
        isFocusPointOfInterestSupported(), View.OnTouchListener

      • isExposurePointOfInterestSupported

        boolean isExposurePointOfInterestSupported()
        Returns:
        true if the devices supports this feature.

      • setExposurePointOfInterest

        void setExposurePointOfInterest(float pointX,
                                float pointY)
        Sets the point where the camera tries to calculate exposure. The camera will update the exposure based on the set position.

        To check if a device supports this feature isExposurePointOfInterestSupported() can be used.

        To utilize this feature a 2D input position on the render surface is required. This can be done by using the OnTouchListener of the render view.
        Parameters:
        pointX - the pixel coordinate in the x axis of the render surface.
        pointY - the pixel coordinate in the y axis of the render surface.
        See Also:
        isExposurePointOfInterestSupported(), View.OnTouchListener

      • setTextureId

        void setTextureId(int textureId)
        Sets the OpenGLES texture id the camera frame should be rendered to.

      • getRenderingCorrectedFov

        float getRenderingCorrectedFov()
        Returns:
        the field of view of the rendered frame. This value should be used to calculate the projection matrix.

      • setRenderingCorrectedFovChangedListener

        void setRenderingCorrectedFovChangedListener(CameraManager.FovChangedListener listener)
        Sets the listener that is invoked when the field of view of the rendered frame changes. The value provided by the listener should be used to calculate the projection matrix.
        Parameters:
        listener - the listener that is invoked when the field of view of the rendered frame changes
